intro: Glyptocaryopsis papillata, commonly known as the papillate grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces distinctive papillate (bump-like) structures on its seed heads, which give it its scientific name. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Glyptocaryopsis papillata is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy plant in harsh environments.
